Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells transfected with PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by 60% for the variant c.318G>A (p.C106Y).
Protein expression was undetectable for the variant c.1295G>A (p.R432H).
Protein expression was increased by 30% for the variant c.1318A>G (p.N440D).

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 70% relative to wild-type.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 30% or greater than 120% relative to wild-type.

Material used.Description: Immunofluorescence was performed on brain tissue from PINK1 knockout mice.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced mitochondrial localization of PINK1 in knockout mice.
No detectable mitochondrial localization of PINK1 in knockout mice.
Increased mitochondrial localization of PINK1 in knockout mice.

Biological replicates.Description: Five biological replicates were analyzed per group.

Technical replicates.Description: Each slide was imaged in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1-expressing mice were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: PINK1 knockout mice were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Mitochondrial signal intensity < 50% or > 120% of wild-type.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial function was assessed using SH-SY5Y cells expressing PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Decreased ATP production by 45% in cells expressing c.318G>A (p.C106Y).
No ATP production detected in cells expressing c.1295G>A (p.R432H).
Increased ATP production by 20% in cells expressing c.1318A>G (p.N440D).

Biological replicates.Description: Four biological replicates were performed per variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each measurement was repeated three times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1-expressing cells were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-expressing cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Kruskal-Wallis test was used for statistical analysis.
